arts.ttl: Lawrence Shankland Hearts woes worsen as fans chant for striker to GO after penalty miss
arts.sum: Neil Critchley has come to Lawrence Shankland’s defence after Hearts fans chanted for the striker to GO following their away loss in Europe. Critchley refused to single out any players for criticism following the loss but has now been forced to defend the striker who topped the Scottish Premiership scoring charts last term.

arts.ttl: Neil Critchley bemoans Hearts 'fine margins' as he urges players to keep believing after Euro defeat
arts.sum: "I thought we were much the better team in the second half, had some good moments and good chances and in a game of few chances you need to take them and we haven't done that. "Sometimes if you're well beaten, not that you ever want to get beaten, then you can understand sometimes that, you know, we've just been beaten by a better team," Critchley continued.

arts.ttl: Neil Critchley tells Lawrence Shankland boo boys to remember who got Hearts into Europe
arts.sum: Skipper blazed a late penalty over the bar as Hearts went down 2-0 to Cercle Brugge - and was hit with a torrent of abuse from the visiting fans

arts.ttl: What Neil Critchley said on Lawrence Shankland, Hearts support and Dhanda decision
arts.sum: Neil Critchley spoke to the press after Hearts' 2-0 defeat to Cercle Brugge. Read everything he said.

arts.ttl: Lawrence Shankland scoring struggles continue with penalty miss in Hearts defeat
Paris Brunner shines as Cercle Brugge beat Hearts in Conference League clash
arts.sum: Cercle Brugge grabbed a crucial three points in Europe as they beat Hearts 2-0 at home. Goals from Malamine Efekele and Gary Magnee were enough for the home side in…

arts.ttl: Cercle Brugge 0 Hearts 0 LIVE goal updates from the Conference League clash in Belgium
arts.sum: Neil Critchley's Jambos are in Belgium looking to bounce back from their only Conference League defeat so far this season

arts.ttl: Kenneth Vargas apologises to Hearts teammates as Neil Critchley makes 'a couple of things clear to him'
arts.sum: The 22-year-old attempted to clear up his remarks on social media by claiming he was misinterpreted, with Cammy Devlin admitting Vargas reached out to him for help. Vargas was dropped for the weekend's 4-1 defeat to Celtic and Critchley now wants to draw a line under the issue after a frank discussion with the frontman.

arts.ttl: Listen: Celtic review and Rangers & Hearts previews
arts.sum: Asim Rabbani, Joshua Barrie and Scott Coyne join Jane Lewis for a bumper European Edition

arts.ttl: Who will win Cercle Brugge vs Hearts? Our writers make their predictions for Europa Conference League clash
arts.sum: The Jambos are in Belgium looking to bounce back from their latest European defeat to Heidenheim
